strapiEdition.headline: Will The Real Slim Chicken Please Stand Up?

posts.title: Happy Holidays from Mycelium Networks
posts.content:
It’s the most wonderful time of the year, and Mycelium Networks wants to help you earn extra cash this holiday season. Join their Host Network and begin earning $15-$55 monthly.

  • A plan for everyone: Mycelium offers plans for renters, homeowners, and business owners, so no matter who you are there's a place in the Host Network for you.
  • Get on the nice list: Sign up today and get paid double for your first month of Hosting! 

Compare plans and join the growing Host Network HERE.

posts.title: Razorback Athletics Reports Record Revenue
posts.content:
For the first time ever, the University of Arkansas athletics department has topped $150m in annual revenue. 

  • The big two: Nearly 70% of the department’s revenue came from football and men’s basketball, the only two sports to turn a profit. 
  • Bouncing back: Ticket sales were a huge driver in the revenue increase, making a huge recovery after ticket sales dropped 121% during the pandemic. 

Read more on the story HERE.

posts.title: MIXD Gallery Curates Art From The Ozarks
posts.content:
MIXD Gallery will host its grand-opening, including a curator-led tour and a first look at their inaugural exhibition, Merging Spaces, this Saturday, Nov 19 from 12-4p. 

  • Locally curated: Located in the heart of Northwest Arkansas at 5100 West Park Avenue #126 in Rogers, MIXD aims to be an accessible art space that promotes regional artists through curated exhibitions and events. 
  • Drop it like it’s art: MIXD Gallery produces quarterly curated “drops” of original, regionally crafted art surrounding a particular theme across a variety of mediums: paintings, photography, sculptures, etc. 

Visit MIXD online for more information HERE.

posts.title: Slim Chickens’ Makes Franchise Times Top 500 List
posts.content:
Fayetteville-based Slim Chickens’ was recognized on the Franchise Times Top 500 list for the second year in a row, jumping more than 20 spots since last year’s ranking. 

  • Chicken trenders: In the last three years, Slim Chickens’ sales grew by 59.8%, reaching $265.05m in revenue. 
  • Not so slim: There are currently more than 190 Slim Chickens' locations around the world, and 1,100 more in the development stage.

Read more about Slim Chickens’ amazing growth HERE.

posts.title: Walmart’s Latest Quarter Saw Growth Across Multiple Areas
posts.content:
Walmart’s third-quarter earnings report revealed total revenue growth was 8.7%, totaling $152.8 billion. 

  • Up and up: Walmart eCommerce sales grew 16% from last year, and Walmart International reported net sales of $25.3b, up 7.1%. 
  • Bulk buys: Income earned from Sam’s Club memberships was up 8% this quarter, and membership numbers are at an all time high for the company. 

Find Walmart’s latest earnings report HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Cross-country: Sarina Farb will be in NWA Nov 18 on her Vegan Van Tour sharing about living a healthy and sustainable life. Learn more HERE.*
  • Barnstormers: Applications are open for the 2023-24 academic year to Thaden School, the #1 Private School in Arkansas.*
  • Ring a bell: Help Salvation Army reach their goal of $320,000 to serve the local community during their annual Red Kettle Campaign. 
  • Hoppy day: After a three-year study, researchers are out to help local breweries craft beer with Arkansas-grown hops. 
  • All aboard: Fayetteville is looking to fill 26 positions on 14 of the city’s boards, commissions, and committees. Apply HERE. 
  • The big screen: Two movies releasing this December feature scenes filmed on the U of A campus and around NWA. 
  • Tell it: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
